alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 9:23PM CST until March 10 at 3:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. For the Trempealeau River...including Dodge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Agricultural and marsh land is flooded. At 9.5 feet, The entrance road to the Trempealeau National Wildlife Refuge is flooded. At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. At 11.5 feet, Water covers part of County Road J in Dodge. At 12.0 feet, Low lying roads around Dodge may flood, including County Road P, as well as along a low spot on County Road J south of Dodge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CST Monday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 10.7 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning by 930 AM CST.
